Detailed Description

An item is at least represented by a text and/or an icon and informs a dispatcher (e. g. a GUI-component) about changes of the item-properties. The representation of the text and the icon is not part of the item itself; usually items are embedded inside a GUI-component which does the drawing of the item in the desired look.

As not all compilers support RTTI but this is very useful especially for items, they provide a RTTI-support by the method Item::IsInstanceOf. This makes it necessary that each item-class gets a unique ID. The IDs from 0 to 999 are reserved for APOXI:

ID: Class

  • 0: Item
  • 1: Action
  • 2: AbstractItemContainer
  • 3: ItemContainer
  • 4: AbstractToggleAction
  • 5: CheckBoxAction
  • 6: RadioButtonAction

Member Enumeration Documentation

anonymous enum
 

Enumerator:
ID 

enum Item::ItemPropertyId
 

When a property of an item has been changed, the message ItemPropertiesChanged will be send to the dispatcher, which is assigned to the item. The message contains a property-index, which indicates the changed property or property-group. The property-indices 0 to 999 are reserved for APOXI. Additional defined ids:

  • 5: FeatureItem::FeaturePropertyId
Enumerator:
UnspecifiedPropertyId  Not every property must have its own id. In this case UnspecifiedPropertyId may be used.
TextPropertyId  Indicates that the 'text' property has been changed (see Item::SetText).
IconPropertyId  Indicates that the 'icon' property has been changed (see Item::SetIcon).
EnabledPropertyId  Indicates that the 'enabled' property has been changed (see Item::SetEnabled).
SeparatorPropertyId  Indicates that the 'separator' property has been changed (see Item::SetSeparator).
ValuePropertyId  Indicates that the 'value' property has been changed.
MarkedPropertyId  Indicates that the 'marked' property has been changed (see Item::SetMarked).
CustomPropertyId  Indicates that a custom property has been changed.

Reimplemented in AbstractItemContainer.

Constructor & Destructor Documentation

Item::Item (   ) 
 

If the default constructor is used, the parameters have to be provided by using the method Init.

Item::Item (  Dispatcher *  dispatcher,
const WCHAR *  text,
const BitmapRes *  icon = 0,
BOOLEAN  enabled = TRUE
) 
 

Parameters:
dispatcher Dispatcher which will be informed about property changes. Usually a window or control is used as dispatcher.
text Text of the item. The GUI-component using the item decides whether the text will be shown.
icon Icon of the item. The GUI-component using the item decides whether the icon will be shown.
enabled Sets the enabled-property. The GUI-component using the item usually indicates the enabled-property by a different look of the text.

Item::Item (  Dispatcher *  dispatcher,
const WString &  text,
const IconSet &  icon_set,
BOOLEAN  enabled = TRUE
) 
 

Parameters:
dispatcher Dispatcher which will be informed about property changes. Usually a window or control is used as dispatcher.
text Text of the item. The GUI-component using the item decides whether the text will be shown.
icon_set Icon set of the item. Specifying an icon set instead of a bitmap or an image allows having a different icon dependant from the given icon-state in Item::GetIcon. The corresponding icon will be retrieved by invoking the customizable methods GuiEngineConfig::GetImageIcon and GuiEngineConfig::GetBitmapIcon.
enabled Sets the enabled-property. The GUI-component using the item usually indicates the enabled-property by a different look of the text.

Item::~Item (   )  [virtual]
 

Member Function Documentation

void Item::BlockNotification (  BOOLEAN  block  )  [inline]
 

If block is TRUE, the notification to the dispatcher regarding changed properties will be blocked. This might be useful when changing the properties of a large number of items in a loop and the notification is done by the application afterwards anyway. Per default the notification is not blocked.

Dispatcher* Item::GetDispatcher (   )  const [inline]
 

Returns the dispatcher, which will be informed about property-changes and when executing an item.

const ImageObtainer & Item::GetIcon (  const IconState &  icon_state  )  const [virtual]
 

Returns the icon for the icon state specified by icon_state. The corresponding icon will be retrieved by invoking the customizable methods GuiEngineConfig::GetImageIcon and GuiEngineConfig::GetBitmapIcon.

Reimplemented in ProviderProxyItem.

const ImageObtainer & Item::GetIcon (   )  const
 

Returns the icon for the default icon state. Wrapper-method for Item::GetIcon(IconState(IconState::DefaultSize, IconState::NormalMode)).

INT Item::GetLanguageId (   )  const [inline]
 

Returns the language ID which is used for the text property.

const WString & Item::GetText (   )  const [virtual]
 

Returns the text of the item. See Item::SetText for details.

Reimplemented in FeatureItem, and ProviderProxyItem.

BOOLEAN Item::HasIcon (   )  const
 

Returns TRUE, if the item has at least one icon. The item allows to have up to 9 items dependant from the icon state. See also Item::GetIcon for details.

The corresponding icon will be retrieved by invoking the customizable methods GuiEngineConfig::GetImageIcon and GuiEngineConfig::GetBitmapIcon.
enabled Sets the enabled-property. The GUI-component using the item usually indicates the enabled-property by a different look of the text.

BOOLEAN Item::IsEnabled (   )  const [virtual]
 

Returns TRUE, if the item is enabled. See Item::IsEnabled for details.

Reimplemented in FeatureItem, and ItemContainer.

BOOLEAN Item::IsEqual (  const Item &  item  )  const [virtual]
 

Returns TRUE, if the content of the item is the same as the content of the item item. The default implementation returns TRUE, if the properties text, icon and enabled are identical.

Reimplemented in FeatureItem, FeatureItemContainer, ProviderProxyItem, and AbstractToggleAction.

BOOLEAN Item::IsInstanceOf (  INT  id  )  const [virtual]
 

Returns TRUE, if the item is an instance of the item-class with the ID id. Must be implemented by each derived class the following way: 

BOOLEAN MyItem::IsInstanceOf(INT id) const
{
    if (ID != id)
        return Base::IsInstanceOf(id);
    return TRUE;
}

Example: if it should be checked, whether an item is an instance of the class Action the following code might be used: 

if (item->IsInstanceOf(Action::ID)) {
    Action* action = (Action*)item;
    ...
}

The IDs from 0 to 999 are reserved for APOXI.

Reimplemented in ContextFeatureItem, FeatureItem, FeatureItemContainer, IndicatorItem, ProviderProxyContainer, ProviderProxyItem, PropertyItem, AbstractItemContainer, AbstractToggleAction, Action, CheckBoxAction, ItemContainer, and RadioButtonAction.

BOOLEAN Item::IsMarked (   )  const [inline]
 

Returns TRUE, if the items has been marked. See Item::SetMarked for details.

BOOLEAN Item::IsNotificationBlocked (   )  const [inline]
 

Returns TRUE, if the notification to the dispatcher regarding changed properties will be blocked. Per default FALSE is returned.

BOOLEAN Item::IsRetranslateEnabled (   )  const [inline]
 

Returns TRUE, if the text property will be translated if the language has been changed. Per default TRUE is returned.

BOOLEAN Item::IsSeparator (   )  const [inline]
 

Returns TRUE, if the item represents a separator. See Item::SetSeparator for details.

BOOLEAN Item::IsSyncModeEnabled (   )  const [inline]
 

Returns TRUE, if the synchronous mode is enabled. See Item::SetSyncModeEnabled for more details. Per default TRUE is returned.

void Item::NotifyPropertyChange (  INT  property_id = UnspecifiedPropertyId  )  [protected]
 

Sends the message ItemPropertiesChangedMsg to the to the dispatcher provided by the constructor or Init. No message is send, if the the item is blocked or the dispatcher has not been set. When adding properties to a derived class, this method should be invoked in the Set-method of the property, if the value is different from the current set value.

void Item::OnLanguageChanged (   )  [virtual]
 

Is usually invoked by the control where the item has been attached and retranslates the text property of the item.

Reimplemented in FeatureItem.

virtual void Item::SetDispatcher (  Dispatcher *  dispatcher  )  [inline, virtual]
 

Sets the dispatcher, which will be informed about property-changes and when executing an item. Usually it should not be necessary to change the dispatcher during runtime.

void Item::SetEnabled (  BOOLEAN  enabled  )  [virtual]
 

Sets the item enabled (enabled is TRUE) or disabled (enabled is FALSE) and sends the message ItemPropertiesChangedMsg with the property-id EnabledPropertyId to the dispatcher assigned to the item.

Reimplemented in FeatureItem.

void Item::SetEnabledProperty (  BOOLEAN  enabled  )  const [inline, protected]
 

Allows to modify the enabled-property for derived classes without triggering a notification to the dispatcher. This might be useful when overwriting the method Item::IsEnabled to assure a consistent state between the internal property and the returned value. Note that invoking this method means a "lazy" updating of the enabled-property and should be used with care, as the dispatcher is not informed about the change. In general it is strongly recommended to use the method Item::SetEnabled for updating the enabled-property.

void Item::SetIcon (  const IconSet &  icon_set  ) 
 

Sets the icon represented as IconSet and sends the message ItemPropertiesChangedMsg with the property-id IconPropertyId to the dispatcher assigned to the item.

void Item::SetIcon (  const BitmapRes *  icon  ) 
 

Wrapper-method for Item::SetIcon(ImageObtainer(icon)).

void Item::SetIcon (  const ImageObtainer &  icon  )  [virtual]
 

Sets the icon and sends the message ItemPropertiesChangedMsg with the property-id IconPropertyId to the dispatcher assigned to the item.

void Item::SetIconProperty (  const ImageObtainer &  icon  )  const [protected]
 

Allows to modify the icon-property for derived classes without triggering a notification to the dispatcher. This might be useful when overwriting the method Item::GetIcon to assure a consistent state between the internal property and the returned value. Note that invoking this method means a "lazy" updating of the icon-property and should be used with care, as the dispatcher is not informed about the change. In general it is strongly recommended to use the method Item::SetIcon for updating the icon-property.

void Item::SetLanguageId (  INT  lang_id  )  [inline, protected]
 

Sets the language ID for the text property. The item remembers the currently used language ID, so that a retranslation in Item::OnLanguageChanged is only done when necessary. For derived classes which have overwritten the method Item::OnLanguageChanged it might be required to set the language ID if Item::OnLanguageChanged is not invoked.

void Item::SetMarked (  BOOLEAN  marked  ) 
 

If marked is TRUE, the item will be considered as marked. The representation depends on the component where the item is added to (usually marked items are inverted). The message ItemPropertiesChangedMsg with the property-ID MarkedPropertyId is send to the dispatcher assigned to the item.

BOOLEAN Item::SetProperty (  ResourceParser &  parser,
const GuiObjectFactory::PropertyId  prop_id,
UINT16  object_id
) 
 

Initializes the instance by reading out a resource file generated by ARAGON. This method may not be invoked by the MMI in a direct manner and might be changed in future releases.

Reimplemented in ContextFeatureItem, FeatureItem, FeatureItemContainer, IndicatorItem, PropertyItem, AbstractItemContainer, AbstractToggleAction, Action, CheckBoxAction, CloseWindowAction, ItemContainer, OpenContextMenuAction, OpenWindowAction, and RadioButtonAction.

void Item::SetRetranslateEnabled (  BOOLEAN  enabled  )  [inline]
 

Activates the retranslating of the text property if enabled is TRUE. Per default the retranslating is enabled: each time the language has been changed during runtime, the text of the item automatically will be retranslated. If this is not wanted (e. g. when showing items representing a dictionary), the retranslating can be disabled by this method.

void Item::SetSeparator (  BOOLEAN  is_separator  ) 
 

If is_separator is TRUE, the item will be considered as separator. The representation depends on the component where the item is added to (usually separator items are represented by a horizontal line). The message ItemPropertiesChangesMsg with the property-ID SeparatorPropertyId is send to the dispatcher assigned to the item.

void Item::SetSyncModeEnabled (  BOOLEAN  enabled  )  [inline]
 

Activates the synchronous mode, if enabled is TRUE. Per default the synchronous mode is enabled: Each time the property of an item is changed, the dispatcher assigned to the item is informed synchronously by the message ItemPropertyChangedMsg. If the synchronous mode is disabled by invoking Item::SetSyncModeEnabled(FALSE), the ItemPropertyChangedMsg is broadcasted to the system so that a variable number of dispatchers may react asynchronously on the message. Note that in this case the applications have to register for the ItemPropertiesChangedMsg by invoking Application::RegisterMessage(ItemPropertiesChangedMsg::ID).

void Item::SetText (  const WCHAR *  text  ) 
 

Wrapper-method for Item::SetText(WString(text));.

void Item::SetText (  const WString &  text  )  [virtual]
 

Sets the text and sends the message ItemPropertiesChangedMsg with the property-id TextPropertyId to the dispatcher assigned to the item.

Reimplemented in FeatureItem.

void Item::SetTextProperty (  const WString &  text  )  const [inline, protected]
 

Allows to modify the text-property for derived classes without triggering a notification to the dispatcher. This might be useful when overwriting the method Item::GetText to assure a consistent state between the internal property and the returned value. Note that invoking this method means a "lazy" updating of the text-property and should be used with care, as the dispatcher is not informed about the change. In general it is strongly recommended to use the method Item::SetText for updating the text-property.

BOOLEAN Item::UsesIconSet (  BOOLEAN *  contains_only_bmps = 0  )  const
 

Returns TRUE, if the icon of the item is represented by an IconSet (this means that the item count is greater than 1).

Parameters:
contains_only_bmps Optional output parameter which is TRUE, if the icon set only contains bitmaps. This parameter is useful when a decision must be done whether an ImageBox should be used or a direct drawing of a bitmap may be done.
